title: Top 10 countries of birth for approved H-1B visas in FY 2024, India leading
description: In Fiscal Year 2024, the H-1B visa program approved nearly 400,000 petitions, with India overwhelmingly dominating as the source country, accounting for 71% of beneficiaries. China followed with 11.7%, while other nations like the Philippines, Canada, and South Korea contributed smaller percentages. This highlights India's significant role in supplying skilled professionals to the US workforce.

Their heartwarming camaraderie highlighted India's ninth Asia Cup crown, secured by Tilak Varma's match-winning knock in a tense chase against their arch-rivals.

Nvidia CEO’s investment tip: Calls this AI company a top pick
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang predicts OpenAI will become the world's next multi-trillion-dollar company, citing fantastic investment opportunities. This follows a $100 billion partnership announcement where Nvidia will invest $10 billion in OpenAI for non-voting shares. OpenAI will utilize this capital to acquire Nvidia's high-performance chips, deploying 10 gigawatts of systems for advanced AI development.

'Victims are our brothers, sisters': Stalin condoles Karur deaths; cautions against rumours
description: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin announced a one-member inquiry commission, led by former judge Arunachalam Jagadeesan, into the Karur stampede that claimed 41 lives. He disbursed Rs 10 lakh to each bereaved family and urged against social media rumours. Stalin stressed collective responsibility to prevent future tragedies, prioritizing human lives, and plans to frame rules for events.

Why Kash Patel's handshake with Pak Army Chief infuriated desis
description: President Donald Trump hosted Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Field Marshal Asim Munir at the White House last week. Among the senior American officials present was FBI Director Kash Patel. While Trump’s hospitality for Pakistan’s leadership was expected, the image of Patel — Indian-origin, Hindu, and a vocal defender of the Ram Mandir — warmly greeting Munir struck a raw nerve. The photo went viral, spawning accusations of betrayal, opportunism, and hypocrisy.

SpaceX Falcon 9 stuns Arizona sky like a comet, deploying 28 Starlink satellites
description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket launched from Vandenberg Space Force Base. It carried 28 Starlink satellites into orbit. The launch lit up the Arizona sky. Many residents saw a bright streaking light. The first-stage booster completed its 28th flight. It landed on the drone ship. These satellites expand internet access to remote areas.

description: Veteran theatre artist and playwright Yashwant Sardeshpande, 60, passed away on Monday morning due to a severe heart attack, causing widespread sorrow. A renowned Kannada theatre actor and popular playwright, he was known for acting and directing numerous plays, including the successful "All the Best," and also appeared in television and films.

description: The UAE introduced new visa categories on September 29, 2025, to attract global talent and support vulnerable groups. Specialized visas for AI professionals, cruise industry workers, event participants, and entertainment specialists aim to boost key sectors. Additionally, humanitarian residency permits now offer stability for foreign widows and divorcees of UAE nationals.

description: ACC President Mohsin Naqvi ignited a major controversy after the Indian team refused to accept the Asia Cup trophy from him, citing his anti-India stance. Naqvi subsequently left with the trophy, denying India their traditional celebration. This incident follows his provocative social media posts and PCB's earlier threats to withdraw from the tournament, escalating tensions.

description: TVK General Secretary Aadhav Arjuna moved the Madras High Court, seeking a CBI probe into the Karur stampede during Vijay's rally. He alleged police and ruling DMK members engineered the incident through electricity disruptions and inadequate arrangements. The petition, which also sought to allow visits to victims' families, was subsequently refused by the high court registry.

This surge is primarily driven by growing expectations of US Federal Reserve rate cuts and a weakening dollar, significantly boosting demand for precious metals. Ongoing geopolitical tensions, including trade disputes and conflicts, are also contributing factors.

His lawyer alleged a "huge conspiracy" involving prominent individuals, while Saraswati faces accusations of misconduct against female students.

description: Former Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik criticised the Indian cricket team for refusing the Asia Cup trophy after their victory. India objected to receiving it from ACC chief and PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi, who is also a minister in Pakistan, due to his controversial social media posts. Malik warned of future regret for the players, despite captain Suryakumar Yadav valuing his team over the trophy.

Authorities are now investigating his family's involvement and questioning other students, with the cleric's brother currently absconding.

'Champion team denied trophy': How PCB's Mohsin Naqvi ran away with Asia Cup silverware
description: India’s Asia Cup 2025 victory over Pakistan turned chaotic off the field, with PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi reportedly taking the trophy and medals after the Indian team refused to receive them from him. The Indian players celebrated with an imaginary trophy, while Suryakumar Yadav and Abhishek Sharma publicly criticised the ACC in the post-match press conference.

World's highest bridge opens to traffic in China
description: China inaugurated the world's highest bridge, the Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge, towering 2,051 feet above a river in Guizhou province. Concurrently, Polish skier Andrzej Bargiel achieved a historic first by climbing and skiing down Mount Everest without supplemental oxygen, a remarkable feat given the extreme conditions at high altitude.

title: 'I am Baramati’s best MLA but Saheb’s record unmatched'; Ajit hails uncle Sharad Pawar
description: Deputy CM Ajit Pawar reflected on his political journey, acknowledging comparisons to Sharad Pawar while highlighting his own dedication as Baramati MLA. He sternly directed police to implement MCOCA against goons at the APMC market, irrespective of their political ties, condemning criminal behaviour. Pawar further rejected attempts to communalize incidents, advocating for secular values and unity.

title: Manipur unrest fallout: Displaced boy ends life at Jiribam camp
description: A 13-year-old boy, displaced by Manipur's ethnic violence, died by suicide at a Jiribam relief camp, renewing grave concerns for internally displaced persons. This incident brings the reported IDP suicides to at least six since May 2023, underscoring the severe mental health crisis. Authorities have initiated an investigation into the tragic death.

title: H-1B visa policy change: Canada PM responds to Trump, says ‘maybe we can …’
description: President Trump's significant H-1B visa fee increase to $100,000 has created a stir, prompting Canada to consider attracting highly skilled professionals. Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and industry experts view this as a "wonderful opportunity" to draw talent left stranded by the US policy, despite potential challenges within Canada's immigration system.
